meanings.definition: To remove the foreskin from the penis.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will circumcise the baby boy tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is common to circumcise male infants.
meanings.sent3: The barber joked that he could circumcise a hair if needed.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully circumcised the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to circumcise the fabric to make it fit perfectly.

meanings.definition: To cut off the foreskin of (a male) or the prepuce of (a female).
meanings.sent1: The tradition in their family is to circumcise male children.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will circumcise the patient in the operating room.
meanings.sent3: The gardener accidentally circumcised the plant while pruning it.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor had to circumcise part of the marble to reveal the statue within.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to carefully circumcise the excess fabric to finish the garment.

meanings.definition: To perform the religious rite of circumcision on.
meanings.sent1: The rabbi will circumcise the baby according to tradition.
meanings.sent2: The priest was asked to circumcise the newborn as part of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he could circumcise a balloon animal.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to circumcise the canvas to start a new painting.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to circumcise the dough to make perfectly shaped cookies.
